member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap
member.summary: A bitmap is a 2D grid of pixels that form an image.

example.p: To load and draw a bitmap, first add a to your XAML page.
Add the image file you want to display (png, jpeg, etc.) to your Visual Studio project, and make sure its Build Action is set to Content.
In the page implementation class (eg. MainPage.xaml.cs), declare a field to hold the bitmap, and another to indicate when the asynchronous load has completed:
Use the CreateResources event to asynchronously load the bitmap:
Use the Draw event to display it:

remarks.p: When using native interop with CanvasBitmap, the version of GetOrCreate that takes a device must be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the bitmap, in device independent pixels (dips).
member.remarks: This property is a convenience shortcut for when you need the bitmap size in Rect format. The value of myBitmap.Bounds is Rect(Point(0, 0), myBitmap.Size).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap.Dpi
member.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch (DPI) of this bitmap.
member.remarks: DPI describes the ratio between device independent pixels (dips) and actual physical pixels. The identity DPI value is 96, which means dips and pixels are the same.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap.GetPixelBytes
member.summary: Returns an array of raw byte data for the entire bitmap.
member.remarks: Works on bitmaps of any format. The size of the array is (Width of bitmap, in pixels) X (Height of bitmap, in pixels) X (bytes per pixel). The number of bytes per pixel is determined from CanvasBitmap's pixel format. For a CanvasBitmap with the default format of DXGI_FORMAT_B8G8R8A8_UNORM, for example, this is 4.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap.GetPixelBytes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of raw byte data for a subregion of the bitmap.
member.remarks: Works on bitmaps of any format. The size of the array is (Width of subregion, in pixels) X (Height of subregion, in pixels) X (bytes per pixel). The number of bytes per pixel is determined from CanvasBitmap's pixel format. For a CanvasBitmap with the default format of DXGI_FORMAT_B8G8R8A8_UNORM, for example, this is 4. The region is specified in pixels (not dips).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat
member.summary: This denotes the format used when saving a bitmap to a file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Auto
member.summary: The actual encoding used is determined from the file extension. If the file extension is not recognized, an error is reported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Bmp
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's bitmap encoder.
member.remarks: This file format doesn't support different quality levels. Different values for 'quality', if specified, will produce the same result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Png
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's PNG encoder.
member.remarks: This file format doesn't support different quality levels. Different values for 'quality', if specified, will produce the same result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's bitmap JPEG encoder.
member.remarks: This format supports the selection of a quality level, between 0.0 and 1.0. Quality 0.0 will produce a low quality image with a small file size. Quality 1.0 will produce a high quality image with a large file size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Tiff
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's TIFF encoder.
member.remarks: This file format doesn't support different quality levels. Different values for 'quality', if specified, will produce the same result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.Gif
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's GIF encoder.
member.remarks: This file format doesn't support different quality levels. Different values for 'quality', if specified, will produce the same result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmapFileFormat.JpegXR
member.summary: Indicates Windows Imaging Component's JPEGXR encoder.
member.remarks: This format supports the selection of a quality level, between 0.0 and 1.0. Quality 0.0 will produce a low quality image with a small file size. Quality 1.0 will produce a high quality image with a large file size. This format is called Windows Media Photo (WMP) in some documentation.
